links_reviews_text: This is a staple coat for your wardrobe. I loved this coat so much and would have purchased it if it wasn't so expensive. Wore it to work, out, errands...everywhere. The only downfall was the sleeves - they fit too tight to layer anything. I would rent again...and again...and again!

This piece is as gorgeous as advertised, lined luxuriously, and clearly put together with impeccable draping. That said, it wrinkles when you so much as breathe, so don't bring it somewhere you want be able to hang it up!
Great fit and color. Not fully lined or super warm so it’s better for fall/spring than deep Winter.

This piece is gorgeous and fully justifies my Nuuly expenses. It's very luxurious and you will definitely get looks and compliments. It takes your whole outfit up a level. It wrinkles easily so be careful where you lay it. It's not meant for real winter weather, it's for cool crisp fall days or early spring. GORGEOUS. I am 5'10 and wore a s/m. It fit perfectly.
It’s a light coat. Good with everything.

I like the style and the color. It's very thin and it works perfectly in my city. The downside of being thin is it become wrinkly immediately after sitting on it, put it on a chair, or anything other than just hanging it. It's quite annoying, not recommended.
super thin, almost like felt and definitely not worth the retail price.

This coat is more for riding in taxis than facing the elements. Know when you rent it that it's a fashion piece, not a practical piece. Don't despair--there are many coats on Nuuly that are both fashionable AND keep you warm! Unfortunately, this isn't one of them.

I wore this coat too many times to count. It’s a great color that’s extremely versatile, and actually does a good job of keeping you warm. Awesome for cold weather over a sweater or cold-ish weather over a typical tee.

First of all, I would like to thank Nuuly for giving me the opportunity to wear a $600 coat. I felt like a million bucks in this and got tons of compliments - but could only wear it once because of how tight it was in the arms. Would be perfect in warmer weather, but I couldn't get it over any of my winter outfits except a tiny turtleneck so I had to wait for a relatively warm day. Will definitely size up if I rent again, which I plan to in the spring!

Great coat to wear w casual and dressy outfits so very versatile. Gave four stars instead of five because it wasn’t lined, which for the price is very surprising. I loved having this for milder winter weather.

Is it possible to be in love with a coat! This coat was the perfect piece to add to my wardrobe. I wore it multiple times and received a number of compliments. I felt like a real New Yorker in my hometown of Baltimore sporting this gorgeous coat. It paired well with just about anything I wore. Seriously considering purchasing this one!
I have never loved a jacket more - will rent again. Would buy if I could afford it!!
Lovely soft coat that’s super versatile. Mine showed up with a hole in the pocket but otherwise was in great shape.
This coat is thin enough to wear indoors but also able to keep you warm outside. The shape is not great but the color goes with everything.
loved it, got lots of compliments

links_reviews_title: Great for a night or day in the city
links_reviews_text: I styled this with all black outfits. From my sisters bridal fittings, night out with the girls, to downtown art events. All on cold winter nights ! It is very warm and I loved wearing it. I gave it 4 stars because I wish the camel hair was faux (I felt so guilty wearing it). I wish I had sized up though to a 2x because it was a little restrictive in the sleeves. Forgot to take any pictures in it and I wish I did!! It’s a great go to coat!

links_reviews_title: Great piece but needs a little work
links_reviews_text: I wore this coat on my trip to NYC. It was between 35-65 degrees while I was there and this kept me warm when layered with a body suit, sweater, coat, and a scarf. That being said, when I got it I was shocked by how thin it was. This coat is not really lined so you have to layer a lot more than you would with an actual winter coat. Another area where I ran into trouble was that the arms were way too short even when just wearing a random tank underneath. If you wanted to layer underneath then the arms get tighter and shorter. For reference, I'm 5'3 115 pounds so I have pretty short arms. On the plus side, it was light weight so it didn't weigh you down, and the color was great and fashionable. I did wear it many times and it was a really versatile piece.

I loved this. If it wasn’t so expensive, I would’ve purchased it. The one I got seemed a biiit worn - some light pilling had started. But it looked amazing over almost everything I put it on top of. One of my fave Nuuly pieces to date.
I wanted to love this coat but I felt like I was wearing a robe/ being swallowed whole when I wore it. It would probably work better on someone who is taller than me.

I LOVE this coat! It fit so well on my petite frame. At just under 5'2", I had no worries that I woud be dragging a train or look like I draped a bulky wool blanket over myself. The color worked with everything that I wore, whether it was casual or more dressed up.

links_reviews_title: Great coat for style, not worth the money
links_reviews_text: For such an expensive coat, I expected more. The pockets had holes in them as well so were unusable. That said, the style was classy and I was able to wear several times.
This robe coat is the perfect lightweight coat, elevates and outfit and beautiful fabric and color.
So comfy, classy, and perfect to throw over just about anything!

Such a classic cut. Great way to elevate any look. This is not a heavy coat. I was surprised that it wasn't lined. It may be due for a few repairs -- when I received it there was a hole in one pocket and along the inside of the left armhole.
loved it
I am typically a 2x but ordered the 1x because of the other reviews stating the coat as oversized. The 1x unfortunately did not fit, waiting for the 2x to be available to rent :)
This is truly the perfect casual-cool jacket. It is warm enough for moderate winter days outside, but light enough to add a chic layer to your indoor outfits.

This coat is a great staple piece for your wardrobe because it will go with everything. I rented it for a weekend trip to Seattle and it was perfect for weather in the mid-40s. Definitely more of a fall coat! Even though I’m normally a small, the XS/S was still an oversized look on me.

This coat was Incredible! I wore this every day almost, didn’t get sick of it and always got compliments! Two notes, it’s real camel hair so I needed to wear long sleeves under it for comfort and there’s no belt to keep it closed.
It didn’t fit well and the fabric was very cheap. Was extremely disappointed.
This coat was great for the winter months

This piece stuns most, seriously. So in style and expensive looking. Great value. Complaint: it wrinkles so quickly yet oddly unwrinkles just as fast. Real complaint? Just got me nervous then actually stunned me. ;)
It runs a little big - wish I would've gotten the XS/S instead of the M/L. But it was a great staple piece and I wore it all the time!
Incredible coat and surprisingly very warm for how thin it is. Pretty sure I wore this 3+ a week.

I wore this coat to work over a dress and out on the weekends with jeans and a fitted tee. It does run a bit large (I'm usually a M and was ok with S/XS) but I will say bc the sizing runs large I found the pockets to be weirdly further back than usual which indicates to me that its supposed to fit very loose.

links_reviews_title: Unflattering fit in shoulders of coat
links_reviews_text: Color & fabric quality of this coat were good - but the way it looked on especially in the shoulders/bust did not look right. It's extremely wide to the point of it being unflattering, and the collar fold is not proportional. Wanted to love, but tried it on and never wore.

First off want to say its a warm coat so that is a plus, however its a lot bigger then it looks on the model. Doesn't have much shape at all so defiantly size down if your looking to rent. Probably wouldn't rent again just cause of the lack of shape.
This went well with almost any outfit! The coat wasn't as warm as I thought though.
Wore this almost every day—sometimes as light jacket, sometimes as a “blazer” at work. Lined nicely for layering. Compliments every. Single. Time. I wore it. I would buy it if it were on discount.
This was my favorite coat but it is definitely lighter than I expected. It is good for fall and spring but won't hold up for winter at all. The fabric is great but the coat is not lined.

Loved the idea of this jacket, but never ended up wearing it because it was way too big. I looked like I was drowning in all of the material, and it was rather thin and wrinkled easily. If you are looking for an oversized camel coat (without any closures or ties, either) then I would def size down. Also probably works better for taller people.
The weather changed on me but would’ve wore if I could!

I wore this SO much! It was the perfect transition piece for fall as it wasn't too heavy but was roomy enough to layer under. I ordered a size up which I usually do in coats but probably could have gone with my regular 1X. Love!

This coat is pretty cute, but it really it is just too big. I ordered above my usual size because they didn’t have my size or even below it. Depending on the look you want and what you plan on wearing underneath this jacket, minimum size down 1 size. It legitimately looked like a robe on me, and honestly I wouldn’t have minded that much if it had been a belted coat. But because it wasn’t it just hung so funny. Cute good but it’s just not the best fit from what I gather!
Very elegant and high-end. Felt chic wearing this. It does wrinkle somewhat easily.
It's pretty large on my frame but cozy and chic!

It wasn’t cold enough to wear it, but it would look good worn over literally any outfit. This type of coat is a must-have staple item and the camel color goes with everything. I was a little surprised at the weight of the coat. It reminds me of a thicker, heavier felt material.

This coat is more like a coat-like jacket and it’s falls effortlessly allowing it to really be a part of your overall look. Loved the quality! Unfortunately it was so warm in Philadelphia when I rented this that I was only able to wear it in the morning.
Lovely shape for a Fall coat. Dress it up or down.

links_reviews_title: Cool Weather, but Make it Fashion
links_reviews_text: My only con is I should've rented this when the weather was cooler. Very nice coat.

links_reviews_title: So cute, will be renting again
links_reviews_text: Beautiful piece, one little complaint is that in the pictures it looks more stiff but in person it’s way softer. Has a different look.

Love everything about this robe coat and got so many compliments on it. I'm an XS and found it to run on the large side but that's the style. High quality but could be a tad itchy at times. This coat goes with everything and would have gotten more wears if the weather was a bit cooler out!

When I pulled this dress out of my shipment I noticed two large stains on it. I tried to launder it. I wash all of my nuuly garments by hand and then hang them to dry. Unfortunately the stains remain and I put it back in the case without trying on.

This dress was easy to slip on, the material nice, and I really appreciated the stripes. I would agree with other reviewers that the dress runs a bit large and made it a bit less flattering than I had hoped.
This dress came to a maxi length on me (5’2” for reference). Got it for a vacation that was canceled and it was too lightweight for brisk spring weather. Would re-try in the summer!
So cute and simple and flattering. The only thing I don’t love is that the slits are higher than I would prefer. The material is sort of a high quality heavy linen. The blue is super pretty. Rent it!

Although this dress was too big for me, the belt made it adjustable enough to wear. The fabric is thick, but the slit on the side allows a breeze. It does wrinkle fairly easily during travel and the fabric can't be steamed, it needs to be ironed. Overall, I highly recommend this dress for vaca! It goes with almost any occasion!

links_reviews_title: Great for the pool or beach
links_reviews_text: So nice wearing this outfit on the beach. Truly comfortable
Loved the fit. Received a ton of compliments. The dress is definitely well made. Loved the silk lining in the pockets.

links_reviews_title: The buttons will not stay closed
links_reviews_text: It is a beautiful dress to wear. However, the buttons are getting loose and will just undo themselves while walking or sitting. The dress fits great and looks great if I do not move.
Easy to throw on summer dress. I loved it. Perfect for barbecues, brunches and lunches. One PSA: Buttons opened a little too easily (I had to keep checking they were done up) but otherwise perfect.
Really pretty dress, but the buttons on the front were placed in a way that gaped on my bust. I wasn't able to make it work unfortunately.
Was hoping to bring this dress on vacation but it ran small and had no stretch at all.
Loved this dress but you really have to iron it before every wear.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful dress, for weekends or the office!
links_reviews_text: Beautiful summer dress! Can be worn in the office or on the weekends depending on styling. Very flattering!
I loved everything about this dress!
Really nice casual dress for summer or vacation. I agree with the other reviews that it is a bit see through but not so much that a slip is needed.
I wore this dress so many times when I had it! It fit well and was appropriate for many different occasions. The only issue I had with this dress is that the linen wrinkled very easily.
Super comfy, linen dress... doesnt get too wrinkly. Felt sophisticated. Fit as expected.
Love myself a good tie at the waist. Classic look, wish it wasn’t such a seasonal item.
Slit in front was a little high so I styled it with pants and it was really cute. Flattering and comfortable.
This dress is gorgeous. The linen is heavy but not scratchy. It felt like a little piece of luxury.

links_reviews_title: Really flattering and perfect for any occasion
links_reviews_text: I really loved this dress. It was comfortable and cozy and flattering. Great for a summer break in Nantucket type of dress! Because of the material it wrinkles quite a bit so wearing it to the office and sitting at the desk all day wasn't awesome because by lunch it was all wrinkled from the waist down. It would be great for a party where you're doing a lot of casual conversation and walking around though!
I loved everything a out this dress! comfortable, breezy with a great fit!

links_reviews_title: Breathable linen dress great for hot summer days
links_reviews_text: Got lots of compliments every time I wore this! I wore it a few times on hot summer days, styled with a pair of flat sandals. The dress is great for low-key daytime activities or just relaxing in. One con: it wrinkles easily and is a bit hard to iron as it is a stiffer linen.

even out of the box, this dress had my heart! i rented several dresses to wear to an event last week that was cancelled due to hurricane, however i was determined to wear this dress once! Nice thick linen, came right out of the box unwrinkled! (that would have been a deal breaker for me. The waist tie and cut of the top worked well for me but might be overwhelming for someone with a smaller bust. I had to order a larger size than i usually wear due to availability and it fit loosely but i would like to see how my regular size would look. Also i would note the photos makes this dress look midi length but it was almost a maxi on me and im quite tall. i would buy this if it goes down in price, i live in florida and would wear it all year! great quality, great style, classic!

Thought this dress would be lovely but unfortunately it did not fit on me through the chest. I am a 34G and I could not get this to button over the chest despite ordering the XL. 3 stars because length is great and I think this would be lovely on, just would recommend being slightly smaller chested for your size.
These are a great staple to any closet... They were a great wash and very flattering. They were VERY stiff at first wear and took a few wears to get them to a comfy place but awesome jeans!
Wore them many times a week, super comfortable and good looking!
These fit, but so strangely.
Loved how these fit.

links_reviews_title: Too long for me but so nice
links_reviews_text: These are great jeans - the fit and quality are great. They were just too long on me to make work, but I took a chance since I'm very short (5'1").
Really like these jeans for a dressed down look. Best if you aren't going to be sitting for most of the day, they stretch out in the butt. Still love them and will wear accordingly

The denim feels like great quality, but that's the only positive I can say. I sized up because of reviews, and still could not get them over my hips. They honestly just felt like they were 2 sizes smaller than what I ordered. There's absolutely no stretch/give.

These were definitely not cute for women with curves. Or pear-shaped women. Fit my waist, could not get my thighs in the legs. So, if you have super skinny legs and a wider middle, these will be perfect. Those with a smaller waist and athletic thighs, not so much.
I loved that these had structure to them, but they fit oddly. I have a big butt and average thighs - weirdly these felt fine in my butt yet the thighs were really tight.

Ran very small-I’m almost always a size 30 jean and these did not fit at all. No stretch whatevsoever so they were also very uncomfortable, on top of being too snug. Too bad because they look so cute in the photo

links_reviews_title: Great looking jeans, but run really small!
links_reviews_text: Sadly, these were not true to size. My first nuuly fail. They were too small to wear :(

links_reviews_title: Cute, but too tight for me
links_reviews_text: I normally wear an 8 or 10 in pants and these were just too tight to fit on me- I got the size 30. May try them in a larger size in the future.

I typically wear a 4/6 in pants. Many people said these run small so I ordered a size 30 to be safe. Let me tell you, I have never had a pair of pants fit so ill. The material was very thick with no give, which is fine, but then I would expect these to be tight all over. I have thick thighs and a booty with a smaller waist. These were uncomfortably tight on my thighs, but extremely shaggy in the crouch area with a way to large waist band. The way they fit my butt was even worse. They did not hug my at all. Hopefully I have a better experience with a different pair of AYR because I've really been wanting to try this brand. I'm sure these look great on some girls, but if you have thicker thighs, I'd suggest looking elsewhere.
These fit more low-rise and bootcut than the photo makes it seems. Looks like the type of cut from the early 2000s (I’m not ready for low rise to be back!)
really wanted to love these jeans, but they were just too small.
The only “weird” part which is why I didn’t want to buy them was that the buttons are a fake gold color and kind of stick out. They were great for rental though! Fit perfectly.
Didn’t wear it, didn’t fit.
I thought about keeping these. Great jeans. Have been wanting to try AYR, am so glad I did. Solid no stretch jeans. HUGE fan
took my normal size in denim, could barely button. but was baggy in the bum area.

I was excited to try AYR jeans but these weren't perfect for me. I am petite, and was able to cuff these but they still overall felt big. I am postpartum and a little between sizes right now, so might have been my fault. However, I feel like I won't be able to wear this brand until they offer petite. I am 5'2".

links_reviews_title: Great jeans but way too small
links_reviews_text: These are great jeans but have no give/ stretch -- I ordered my regular size in Madewell/ Gap jeans and couldn't even get them on -- I would have needed to order up 2 or maybe even 3 sizes. Be warned! :O

I loved the color of this pair but they were too high wasted for me to wear comfortably.the length was a little awkward too. They would probably look better on someone taller. I’m 5’2” and they were full length on me.

links_reviews_title: a little too big all over
links_reviews_text: This denim is a nice wash, but stretched out quite quickly and had to wear a belt to keep them at my waist. I am a true size 26, but these fit more like a 27.
Slightly big in waist and narrow in thighs
Great fitting jeans! Flattering
I loved the high waisted stretch in the waist. Cute style and could dress up or down. I will definitely try another pair in this name brand!
Dressed these jeans up and down!
These jeans were perfect!! I was going to buy them but they a bit expensive...they were really stretchy and help suck in your belly a little! A very nice length too!!!
So cute, but also beyond comfortable. Bought these

links_reviews_title: I am always a 27 so that's what I ordered in this brand. I wish I would have went up a size. They were a little tight so I only wore them once.
links_reviews_text: I wore casual with a sweater.

I loved these jeans, they were stretchy enough that they were comfortable but I could tell they were made well. Thought about buying but decided to see if there were any other AYR styles I might like better.

These jeans are perfect for shorties. The most comfortable jeans I ever wore. I felt like I was wearing sweatpants - in a good way. The denim is insanely soft but still thick. The waistband is very stretchy. Great cut.
I’ve been living in these jeans. I struggle to find a good kick flare jean that aren’t too long, but these are perfect. Love!!
These were soo flattering!! Very high-waisted and looked adorable with booties. The slits on the inside + the raw hem made them a little more casual but they paired well with literally anything!

Freaking love these jeans! High quality material and smoothing on the stomach. Perfect rise if you prefer high rise jeans, like me, and just enough flare to make the pants more flattering/interesting. Wore with everything - sandals, booties, etc. and would buy if they weren’t so pricey.
fabric is great - cant help it didn't look great on me cuz I gained a little wait. lol

These jeans are amazing! SO SOFT and great for people who are shorter - They were a weird length but still looked great with socks and boots - the socks would show a bit, but with cute socks it was alright. I loved how they were high waisted and made me look skinny. Very comfortable pants, wore them a bunch!
Incredibly comfortable, modern cut, great fit and super soft denim.
Loved these jeans! So soft and fit me perfectly - just a tad too long for me (5'2). I still ended up wearing them with heels but they hit a little longer on me than the model.

I absolutely loved these jeans! They had the perfect amount of stretch to hug curves, but not too much where I had a saggy butt by the end of the day. They were soft, comfortable, and on trend. My only gripe is that I'm on the shorter side so they weren't quite as cropped as I would have liked but I can't fault the jeans for that. Just wanted to mention that to any other vertically challenged folks out there :P

links_reviews_title: Mid-to-high waisted, comfy jeans with nice shape
links_reviews_text: Everyday or weekend jeans that let me bend, squat, and chase my kids all around the city. Also great for airplanes, so comfy.

These jeans have a very generous stretch and are super soft and comfortable to wear. They fit true to size, but I might have ordered up a size so they'd be a little looser. I love the slit on the inside of the leg too!
easy, comfortable and stylish.
The vivid color of this dress was the first thing that caught my eye when I unzipped my nuuly. I wore this with gray leggings and black ballet flats to tone it down a bit for work.
I liked this dress, but I think it would have looked a little short / sheer without tights.
was great for winter with black tights and booties, super cute
Love this dress so much. I may buy it. Comfortable and very flattering.

Cute pattern and lace detail, but the fit of this dress is very off. I'm usually a medium but the top was a bit over sized and the skirt was short and a bit tighter than I would have liked. May be better if you're not very curvy as the waist-cinch doesn't really hit at the natural waist, more like the hips.
Super cute dress for work. I am a size 6 and ordered a small based on the reviews. I shouldda ordered a medium. Then again those 5 lbs I gained at Christmas...
Looks great. Comfortable. Wore to work and out to dinner.
Great throw on and go dress
This dress can be dressed up with pumps or down with boots and tights. Get lots of complements either way!

I really loved this dress and wore it higher on my natural waistline due to the elastic and think it looked way better. The pattern is gorgeous and so easy to dress up or down! A little more conservative because of the neckline so you can definitely wear it to work.
LOVED this dress — wore it and received non stop compliments. Def a little see through so wore with tights. Highly recommend this

Only small was available, so the dress is more fitted on me than in the picture, but it has stretch and looks great. I thought I would want Medium, which would probably fit too, but I love this look so much, I'll be keeping the small!

I ordered a size L as most euro brands tend to fit a little more snuggly than American ones--good call! It's fits me loosely, but not like a bag, which can sometimes be the case with this style. I received so many compliments while wearing this dress. It's distinctive without being loud and modestly sexy, so okay for the office (unless you work in a conservative one). I'm definitely going to wear it again.

I could not love this dress any more than I did. There's a really good chance I'll rent it again in the future. The pattern with lace accents are a perfectly combination of edgy and delicate. I'm petite and the length was just above my knee, but good for my lifestyle with kids. Definitely rent it if you're thinking about it!

While I typically do not wear animal print, this one is different. The colors are beautiful and the dress is very flattering. I wore this a few times and received tons of compliments. The ruffles worried me at first but they blend in well and give the dress great movement. The fit was spot on as I usually wear a small and this small fit me perfectly. Easy dress to wear with heels or with casual sneakers.
I love this dress! I bought it!! It is so flattering. I'm typically a small, but only an XS was available so I took the chance. It fit great! Received so many compliments!!
This is a showstopper. Wore it to work and then out. So cute! Couldn't wear it too often b/c it's very distinct. Will definitely rent it again though.
Because of the waist being smocked in the back, I could pull it down to my hips to make it longer for the office, and up to my waist to make it more “fun” for drinks!! Very cute!

I ended up wearing the waist of this dress at my natural waist, instead of as a drop waist as shown in the images. The dress has built in elastic at the center back, so it held the waist band at my waist and the material on top bloused over a bit. I think it was much more flattering that way and I got a ton of compliments on it!
I could live in this and instantly upgraded my look. No need to put an outfit together, either. Throw on and go. Super flattering and got a ton of compliments plus it’s so comfy.
I wish this would have fit as the print is stunning! For an XL, it was really tight throughout the hips. Not great for those with longer torsos either.

links_reviews_title: Not as pretty as the picture and a difficult fit
links_reviews_text: The material is high quality and it's well-made. I didn't think the colors or fabric were as nice in person as I'd hope they'd be. I'm 32/30/40 and I ordered an XS. I wish I'd ordered one size larger. The XS got bunchy around my midsection. If it wasn't so tight around my hips, I think the waist area would have hung lower and fit better. The XS was the correct length for me (I'm 5'4").

it was a little long for me, i had to wear to with heels. with around two and a half inch wedges worked perfect for me, im 5' 4", and i didn't want to go with the petite sizing just in case it was too short.

such a fun jumpsuit!!! so comfortable, flowy, print and color makes a statement! definitely perfect for a one-and-done rental because let's be honest, it's hard to forget something like this. was great for vacation!

links_reviews_title: Dress like a Bohemian yacht princess
links_reviews_text: The fabric is of good quality and forms to your curves without clinging to your body. Pros: petite hemming, no bra needed, neckline not too low. Con: The midsection has some extra fabric and creates a kangaroo type pouch.

So sad. This looked fab. Reviews indicated this was on the long side; I sized up to a L anyway hoping for some extra length, BUT it didn’t even hit my ankles. It was loose in the waist while being tight across the chest. Also, beware the pockets - they add some bulk to the hip for sure. If everything else was on point, I would have had them tailored out before wearing.
So pretty and flattering. I'm seriously considering buying
I absolutely love this jumpsuit. It was a perfect fit, super comfortable and very unique. It was also very flattering. I considered purchasing but a little out of my price range. Highly recommend!!

links_reviews_title: great for a night out in south beach!
links_reviews_text: wore this jumpsuit out to dinner in south beach this winter - it was such a fun print and really well made. highly recommend for a vacation outfit!
Great print and nice drapey soft fabric but I have a long torso and even sizing up did not work for me on this style.

So this jumpsuit is every bit as amazing as the photos suggest and for my longer torso/shorter legs a great fit. Super comfortable, super flattering, and although definitely a statement piece really wearable. I took it on vacation to a beach resort and it was perfect. The item I received had some obvious wear and tear that I was able to work around temporarily (and cheers to Nuuly for handling this issue well) or else I would have kept it.
For all its flair, this jumpsuit is actually super versatile and comfortable. And huge bonus: it doesn't require gymnastics to get into or out of! Highly recommend!

links_reviews_title: Loved for my trip to Thailand!
links_reviews_text: This was an incredible piece. It fit well, was flowy, the petite was perfect, and I wore this a lot on my 10 day trip to Thailand. I felt stylish and cute, yet super comfortable. Wore with some tennis shoes.

Oh my god I was so obsessed with this jumpsuit. It was so far outside of my comfort zone but I was absolutely thrilled with it. I'm typically wary of jumpsuits because they are almost always too short on me. This one was a perfect length and so much fun. I wore it on vacation to Universal Orlando and it was a little chilly that day so I wore a chambray button down over it and it looked so stinking cute. I would recommend this jumpsuit any day.
I rented this once in a medium, which is my normal size, and I wore it a few times even though it was just too big. I rented it again in a small (which i never am!) and it was perfect

Wore this to a big art show and I loved it! It's very comfortable and stylish! A woman stopped me to tell me how beautiful it was. I would have liked it to be a tad longer with my long legs but other than that the fit was perfect!
I’m tall 5’10 and this was ankle length on me. Still thought it was awesome.

Perfect outfit for a 70s party I attended. Got tons of compliments! Only downside was that the length was too short. The XS also fit but length was even shorter so went with S. If you are shorter than me but similar weight and build go XS.

links_reviews_title: Went with a size up for length
links_reviews_text: Didn't wear this because I also ordered in size small because I needed more length. Super cute though for a 70s themed party!

I really think they get ladies' bodies and their material is outstandingly comfortable. Would have bought them, but I own so many jeans already that are along the same vein. Highly recommend this maker!!

I think we can all agree that the best thing about Pilcro and the Letterpress denim is how soft they are. I finally decided to buy a pair as splurge for Mother’s Day. I love the patches. I love that this pair has neural patches so they are easy to put into outfits. Love.
They were very comfortable and soft. Fit perfectly though a little long, but I didn't mind having to cuff them. Wore them so many times and got a lot of compliments!

I really like these comfy little patchwork jeans. I styled them with some cute plaid button downs or a cream sweater. They were a little on the large side but that made them super comfy. Great for the weekend or a casual Friday
These are great but they stretch out fast. Maybe order a size down?

I’ve been wanting to try these jeans for a while and was not disappointed. My usual size wasn’t available, so I sized up one. They were loose like a boyfriend jean but not too baggy. Would consider buying but I want to try my regular size first.
They fit great. Stretch was perfect. I liked were they hit my waist.
I wore these so much. It’s rare that I can find a relaxed fit pant that actually flatters my soft curvy body but these totally nailed it. Will def rent again. Actually I am already missing them.
Excellent quality, incredible weekend denim.
Very comfortable jeans. A consistent 27, these do feel a tiny bit loose. Overall, a nice casual statement piece.

I never wore these, the rise was quite low and I'm used to (and prefer) at least a mid-rise these days. The wash was much lighter in person than it looks in the picture. The combo of rise and wash just wasn't flattering to me in the least.

I was so excited about these jeans but they were just too low for me. The length was perfect but I didn't realize they would be so low when I ordered so I never wore them. A little big in the waist, I would order down a size if ordered again.

Like another reviewer said, the "boyfriend" styling really made these a bit baggy and they loosened up further as I wore them, but despite the loose fit, they were really flattering. I liked being able to put something on that felt like it had more style and thought behind it, and the patchwork def did that vs. one solid color denim.

This is a pair of jeans I would like to invest in. They fit like they were made for me, and how often does that happen with jeans? They are comfortable, cute, and fun. They also did not stretch out over time, which I appreciated!

Order on the smaller end of my size range so they would be more of a true fit than a boyfriend fit, especially since they have a lower rise and I didn't want to be pulling them up a ton. The "tight" fit was still loose enough to have lots of movement, they are super comfortable and easy to dress up and wear more casually.
These are super cute but baggy on the waist and quite stretched out. if you're slim, I wouldn't recommend them. If you have a fuller shape, they might be great!

links_reviews_title: LOVED, even if they were a bit too roomy.
links_reviews_text: The sizing issue was kind of my fault for ordering a 16W. I am usually a 14 or 16 in pants, but I forgot that with Anthro, a 14 usually works. I like the loose-fitting "boyfriend jeans" look, but even then, these were a little too big on me and they would have been more flattering if slightly more fitted, especially around my waist. That said, I wore them a few times anyway because I LOVED their look and feel. If available in a 14 I'd rent (or probably purchase) for sure.
Love this label and these jeans did not disappoint. Wore with the velvet ruffle blouse and booties on a casual Friday.
It was too big! Really bummed out - material is thick and stretchy, wish it would fit. Size down.
The rise on these jeans were too low. I know that’s coming back in but I’m just not a fan of it on myself

These jeans are amazing!! I’ve always love Pilcro Jeans but had never tried the boyfriend fit. They are slightly loose because of the boyfriend fit, which I love! I bought them because I loved them so much.

Love these jeans. Definitely that something different. Fits very well. Perhaps a bit loose, actually. I'm a 14 in jeans, generally -- or a 16 if it's a slim-fitting jean, sometimes -- and went for the 33. Will wear these lots. The patches are actually sewn in (not faux). Glad to know this label works for me.
Fine
I loved these jeans and their fun patches! Did have a tendency to slide down a bit- but I enjoyed them nonetheless

Good fit, comfortable, minimal stretch. I probably should have bought these. Looked good on with a variety of tops and I received lots of compliments. Fun but wondered if I would tire of the patches. Guess that's why we rent them.
Loved that these are made to fit loose and the patchwork gave them character ;-)
Love anything Pilcro. They always fit perfectly. These were no exception.

Not only do these jeans fit perfectly to size, they are super cute and insanely versatile. I've worn them rolled up and down with flats and boots. The patches are a cute touch too! I got so many compliments.
Loveeeee! Absolutely lovely! So cute. Very much a boyfriend fit and TTS. so perfect for fall and layering with tees and sweaters. Loved with sneakers and flats.

These jeans are very soft and just stretchy enough to be comfortable. I ordered my usual size, but definitely could have sized down a size (maybe even two if you're usually on the smaller end of your size). The jeans are definitely meant to be baggy, but by the end of the month I had worn them several times and they had stretched so that the only thing keeping them up was the fact that I have a booty and hips ;) Overall they were a lot of fun and very comfortable!

links_reviews_title: Runs a bit large, nice look
links_reviews_text: Like the distressed look of these jeans. I Ordered the 26 yet 25 would have been a better fit.
Nice and Comfy jeans. I would wear it again. So versatile.
These feel like jeggings, BIG fan of the material. They fit me really well and I am definitely purchasing them! Such a cute pair of denim and for every season of the year!

I'm so glad I added these jeans to my shipment. I based my size on other people's reviews - I normally wear a 28, so I sized down to a 27 and they fit perfectly. I also wear a 27 in Free People jeans, so If you wear that brand then that could be a good comparison.
Patches are nifty
I loved how these looked, but I had to wear with a belt and I had to roll the bottom of them a few more times than I normally do. Otherwise, very cute. I recommend sizing down!
These jeans are the closest to comfort you can get without throwing on sweats. The pattern really adds some pizzazz to a regular boyfriend jean. There's not much not to love about these.
Loved the looks, were comfy fit too... just a tad too big, but still worked!

These were fun to try, something I would be cautious to buy because I wouldn't be sure they were "me." I am used to high waisted now, so it took a little getting used to, having my waist exposed. I accidentally ordered a size down, and they were a little snug in the waist but not bad. I consider them pretty true to size. I wore them with a pretty plain top because it felt like a lot going on with the patches. Fun, but probably not for me every day.

links_reviews_title: Cute jeans with a stretchy pattern
links_reviews_text: I love the look of these jeans with the patchwork but I was hopeful for a bit thicker denim material. I’m in between sizes so I sized up, hoping they would bring a “boyfriend fit” but instead they looked slightly loose. Still cute and go with a lot so I am able to wear them with a few things!

These jeans are so easy to take from casual do dresses up, so cute. They didn’t have my size left so I had to size up and cinch with a belt. Only downside is it sometimes gave me a camel toe. Otherwise, love!!
fun design, well made, runs large...I usually wear size 29 in jeans, I should have order size 28
I would have bought these. Buttt I’m about 5’10” and the pants were slightly too short if I chose to wear them around my waist instead of low on my hips. Otherwise I loved them.

Loved these pants: they were comfortable, looked amazing on me, and could be dressed up or down. I wore them to game night with a plain white tee and jean jacket and also wore them to work with a classic button down, statement necklace and loafer inspired mules. My only complaint is that they pilled/the fabric got caught easily. Otherwise I would have bought them in a heartbeat
The pants rock. Love them!
I didn't actually wear these out in public, they didn't do anything for my figure, maybe a bit too oversized for me, but the color is really pretty.
I'm normally a M but these ran large. I will try and rent again and try for a S. GREAT and trendy/fun pair of pants. Great material and great color.
Comfortable and stylish - could easily dress up or down but at 5'1", definitely had to wear a shoe with heels so the pants wouldn't drag on the ground. Loved these!

links_reviews_title: Waist too large for such heavy pants
links_reviews_text: High hopes led to disappointment, these wound up in the sweet (or, not so sweet) spot of too-heavy fabric with a slightly too-large waist. Lighter weight pants would probably be more forgiving to a slightly “off“ fit, but with a loose waist these were pulled down by the fabric’s weight and suffered the unflattering “droopy drawers” effect. Pear-shapes gals, perhaps consider sizing down.
The pants are beautiful. Have a pretty shine to them when light hits. Love the slit up the sides. Received a lot of compliments each time I wore and very comfortable!
Just not my style

It is made with a thick material and its fun color. It brightened up my workwear and it was chic for and causal for lunch with my friends. My only frustration was that the thick elastic waist band got twisted very quickly after normal wear

While I would agree with other reviews about the likeliness of snags or pilling of the fabric, I was very impressed by the fit and overall style of the pants. The wide-leg was very flattering and the color perfectly on trend.

These pants are gorgeous. The color is stunning and the fit was good.... Except that they were long. I could barely wear them with flats (I'm short so this isn't the first pair I've had this problem with). Still managed to make them work though. They came a little worn, the fabric isn't the best and there are areas where it looks pulled. I would buy them except for that. Many compliments every time I put these on and they are extremely comfortable!
Long length pants. The fabric has a bit of shimmer or sparkle to it.

links_reviews_title: perfect pant, mine had been rented a few two many times
links_reviews_text: LOVED these pants. I'm S/XS in most pants and sizing slightly down was the move, like past reviews said. The only thing with these pants was the pair I received had loose strings and fuzz all over them when they arrived. I didn't wash them for fear of making it worse so got less wear out of them then I would have liked, but definitely will rent again.
You can style these up or down. Length was great on me - but I'm a short 5'5'.

I was very excited to get these but unfortunately they were way too big and looked almost silly. However, if they had fit right, I would have definitely worn them. The material is thicker than I expected and almost has a sheen to it, but they are well made, a fun color and design.

These pants are both comfy AND make me feel chic and put together. If anything they may run a tad large, but it really depends on the size of your waist and hips (I have an hourglass figure, so the waist just needed to be cinched a bit tightly). Considering buying these.

links_reviews_title: Cute and colorful but not in great shape.
links_reviews_text: Love the color of these pants. But the ones that came for me had a few visible snags and wear on them. Seemed a little larger around the waist, and the elastic waistband had a tendency to flip inside of the pants which would make it lumpy. Overall, just ok.
I loved these pants, but so glad I just rented. They snag very easily and the fabric doesn’t seem like it would wear well after a few times. Fun color and fit.

These pants are way out of my comfort zone, style-wise. I usually stick to neutral colors and a more straight leg fit, but these looked so cute in the photos, that I had to try it. After all, that's the whole point of renting your wardrobe, right? Getting to try on new styles is what it's all about! I am so glad I took the chance on these, because they are absolutely beautiful. The color is gorgeous, and the fit itself is incredibly flattering. I'm pear-shaped, so I've always stayed away from wide legged pants in fear of my hips looking gigantic, but these drape so beautifully that it actually accentuated the best parts of my lower body. It took me a few tried to tie it into a fashionable knot because the straps are shorter than I would have liked, but once I got the hang of it, it looked very chic. Would highly recommend this style to anyone wanting to try a bold look.
Surprised by length. I’m petite and 5’2” and I could not wear heels because they were too short. Would have worn more with flats if we didn’t have snow. Always got complimented when I had these on.
Loved these and wanted to wear but ran too big in waist.
I am a size 27, and even the small was too big.
I absolutely loved these pants. I got so many compliments from other women on these. They are so comfortable and I wore them like 20 times.
Super cute. I wore these to work and also another time to the airport and out and about. They can be dressed up or down. Great pants!
Great material! Stretchy but thick. I’m short so I Wore them with wedges and they looked adorable.
For me this was too tight in the waist, hips and thighs. I also didn't love the fabric. It was heavy weight but flimsy - it didn't have a firm hold.

I really liked these pants and wore them several times to work, but they did arrive with some snags in them. I believe it's because of the material they're made from. It wasn't super noticable which is why I still wore them, but don't rent these if you hate that kind of thing.
Loooved them. Great for work and then a night out. Need to wear with heels.
I loved the thickness of the fabric and the length. It wasn’t the most flattering on me hut I still had fun playing with them!
Loved the color and the material but they were huge. Never wore them because they would have fallen off

These parts were so comfy and the compliments I got while wearing them were plentiful. They are the perfect fall showstopper. Being stretchy, they fit super well without being uncomfortable. I do agree with other reviews, they don't seem to be very well made, after the first wash strings were hanging out of different places on the pants.
These pants are so comfortable, cute and colorful! I received so many compliments and now am missing them and wish I bought them.
This fabric feels...weird on your skin. Not soft...not scratchy...idk.

links_reviews_title: Loved the idea, hated the execution
links_reviews_text: Not a style for any one shorter than 6' unless you want a lounge pant that doubles as a blanket.
I loved how these fit. I’m 5’4 and was able to wear with flats. They could be dressed up or down. I would buy them however they are a heavy material and too warm of a fabric to invest in for Arizona.
Great fit, just could not justify purchase.
This didn't work out for me. It's a pull on style that's not too flattering if you have more around the waist. Also, the fabric was thinner than I expected.
These were not quite my style but I am glad I tried them. I styled them with a cozy oversized cardigan and black tank.

These pants were super comfortable and could be worn at a variety of everts. I wore mine to class and some meetings with a cream blouse. They are slightly big around the waist and in length. I have really long longs (5'9") and these were still too long for me. The material also balls up relatively easily. It was balled up in certain places when i received it and it continued to ball up as I wore it.

Get these! They are a gorgeous gold knit material, that solicited compliments from everyone who saw them. I wore these to a rehearsal dinner, to work, and out to eat- they work for any occasion and can be dressed up or down.

links_reviews_title: High Quality Flowy Pant for Fall
links_reviews_text: These pants and this color are awesome for Fall. I paired these pants with a blouse for work, and another top from Nuuly (pictured below) for the weekend. Got tons of compliments on them.
Loved these! Thicker than expected. Great transition piece
Got a million compliments, fit amazingly for any body type, and just made me feel so stylish!
Did not like the material
So fun! Got lots of compliments. I’m 5’8” and wear a 10. The medium was perfect.

These pants are a gorgeous color and I’m crazy about the cut and style, but the material is beyond questionable. It looks cheap, is almost shiny, and catches on EVERYthing. Couldn’t believe how bad they looked after wearing them only twice.
I would live in these if I could.

Fit true to size. Maybe a tad long. I wore these a few different ways - with casual cut off tee or nicer top for dinner with heels. The one issue I had was some fabric pilling And the waistband twisting.

Well, I was surprised at how glittery the fabric of these pants is- somehow I missed that in the photos. The fabric is very heavy and they have long slits up the legs. Overall, they're OK but I wish they were more flattering in the tummy area. I'm generally a 10/12 in pants and I think I could've gone for the medium- maybe it would've held things in place in a more flattering way. Wore once, styled with a white button down similar to the model, but with the material being what it is, I could see these being dressed up or down. Just OK, wouldn't rent again.
I love these pants-I wore them while traveling in South Korea. They were super comfortable and fashionable! Love them!

This pants are a nice, thick sweater knit in a fun color. The tie waist and slits add fun details. They do run a bit big so I had to wear them with my highest heels! I wanted them to sit at my high waist, but they were too big for that and I wasn't able to make it work even with the tie. Styled them with a fitted striped tee, navy linen blazer, and clogs for work.

links_reviews_title: Comfy pants with a touch of class
links_reviews_text: Love the funky color for fall. Definitely runs big in the waist so size down. Pretty lightweight but a little long. Looks great dressed up or down!

links_reviews_title: LOVE these but showed wear easily
links_reviews_text: Loved these pants- perfect amount of drape, beautiful sheen to the fabric. The petite was perfect for me at 5'3" with flats, but for heels I would have done the regular. These were super comfy and paired well with a graphic tee for a casual look, or a blouse to dress them up. Overall I loved them, with the caveat that they did pill very easily and got caught on anything I rubbed against.

links_reviews_title: Poor quality material great color and cut
links_reviews_text: The material of these feels nice and unique, but gets caught on everything and runs leaving trails of fluff. It runs as easily as cheap pantyhose. It got caught on a pencil, a binder, and a grocery basket. threads fluffed up and looked ridiculous for the rest of the day at work. Otherwise it was a great cut, and color. I had such high hopes when I got it.
Loved the color, loved the drapiness, they were slightly too long and I’m 5’7”

I wear it to work and got a lot of nice complaints. It fitted nicely. I like the split at the bottom of the pants and that they were nice and long. The fabric is a little fragile, so it may pull on any sharp edges but overall, I really liked the pants. 😊
Dress was lovely. Paired it with a denim jacket. Fit was good.
This dress was fine. It wasn't ugly, it wasn't the best thing I've ever worn. I wore it once. Fit well. Has a lining underneath which I used as bust coverage. Soft.

I added this dress to my Nuuly because the reviews implied that it was large and roomy in the bust. Sadly, it just fits (barely). I am 15 weeks pregnant with second baby and curvy to begin with. I could just squeeze into this and will definitely only be wearing once. I would suggest sizing up or skipping all together if you're pregnant or really busty in general.

links_reviews_title: Not as flattering for hourglass figures as I expected
links_reviews_text: It’s a shame, because I super loved the pattern on it! The colors were also perfect. Hoped that I could enjoy wearing this during the daytime, but the bust was awkward. The built in lining is sewed in at the waist, leaving it challenging to line up the top half in the most flattering way. I found myself constantly adjusting it throughout the day and feeling uncomfortable overall. If you are curvier or bustier, it’s going to end up feeling fussier
The bust of this dress is gigantic and hung down the front. Unrealistic proportions.
Wore to work with tights, boots and a blazer. Great colors
I can't tell you anything really specific. It was just frumpy.

links_reviews_title: Really cool pattern but needed a belt
links_reviews_text: This was super pretty and the material was really nice but the dress ran big and it made it a little shapeless. A belt would have fixed it
This dress is very comfortable and it has POCKETS! I loved the muted colors and the length was perfect. So cute.
Such pretty colors and pattern but the fit was not it. The bust was way too roomy even with my most uncomfortable padded push-up bra. It was totally unflattering and unwearable.
great dress. Very comfortable and flattering. The tie was great, and it was a great length. I wore with jean jacket and flip flops, but could dress it up as well.

links_reviews_title: Didn't fit but loved it anyway
links_reviews_text: Wore it on 3 different occasions. Got so many compliments!

links_reviews_title: Cute but not flattering on me
links_reviews_text: Loved the print but there was a lot of fabric and it didn’t look flattering
This dress was more light weight than I really needed, so I didn’t wear it, but was flattering. Fits true to size for anthropology.
The shoulders and bust were extremely loose/floppy, and I wear a 34D.
My mistake ordering this in October; there weren't enough hot days to make the most of its breezy style. The fabric is nice, it has a slight Swiss dot texture.
Not a great fit if you're long-waisted and/or bigger in the hips and bottom. It's also pretty light fabric so definitely best for summer

links_reviews_title: Runs way bigger than I thought - Cute though!
links_reviews_text: I really liked the look of this dress, but it was far too big on me. I made it work with a different belt, and actually liked the longer length of dress(usually these types of dresses are short on me). The bust area was gapingly larger, and the waist is stretchy, so there was just too much fabric losing a lot of the shape. Colors are beautiful!
The fit is very weird - my dress had a very saggy fit around the boob area, while the slip inside was very tight.

links_reviews_title: Wanted to love this but the fit was odd.
links_reviews_text: The fit on this is kind of odd. The colors were vibrant and it was lightweight for warm weather so I wanted to love it. The slip underneath kept showing and the waist was a bit tighter than expected. Still cute, just not my favorite dress.
I wore this for my husband's 40th birthday party. It was sooooo cute! Fits true to size, you can belt to your comfort, and POCKETS. I paired it with some booties.

The print was cool but the fit was a little strange. I had a medium and it fit ok, but the front of the top dress was way too big. I’m a B cup and the top dress seemed like it needed a safety pin between the boobs to stay closed. I liked that it had pockets and the length was appropriate for work. But I wouldn’t buy it...
Lovely colors and great fit. Ran a tad on the big side so I’m glad I sized down. Flattering fit for anyone.
Honestly not sure why I always size up in dresses but this dress is true to size so obviously sizing up made it too large for me. Very cute pattern, comfy/breathable material though.
Great dress! Very flattering. I wore it to work and out to dinner and got tons of compliments.

links_reviews_title: So pretty! But size up in plus
links_reviews_text: Was so looking forward to this pretty dress. Sadly, it didn't fit anything like I was expecting. It was too small through the arms/ shoulders, as well as the hips.
When I first tried it on I wasn’t sure. I decided to wear to work anyway. Once I got it put together it ended up being a stunner. Got lots of compliments at work.
It runs a little big and the lining is thinner than I’d like. I wore it with a black tank under it.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful in person but runs large
links_reviews_text: Size down at least one size. I was so bummed because this dress is gorgeous

Absolutely love this dress, and got so many compliments. Great day dress with a lot of look minus the fuss. It has an attached slip with it, which I love so you don’t have to think about what goes underneath. I typically wear a 2/4 in dresses and the XS was perfect.

links_reviews_title: Surprised by how much I loved this dress!
links_reviews_text: I'm typically not a huge fan of bright pinks like this but let me tell yall, I LOVED this dress. It was so so pretty and just the right length. The fit was wonderful and I will definitely be renting it again.
This is a beautiful pop of color, and I wore it with leggings for several work meetings. It runs a little big, but not so huge as to be unwearable.

This tunic can definitely be worn as a dress! I wore it with either leggings or tights, but it would be long enough to be a dress in the spring/summer. The material is really thick with a lot of embroidered detail I hadn't noticed in the photos. The cut of the top is very nice - not too low cut, but just showing enough. It is a cut that's definitely appropriate for a casual workplace. Love the color.
Fun fabric. Good length. Runs very big.
Not good fit for busty chicks like moi. Also just wasn't in love with the cut. Not my thing.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous colors, comfortable and doesn’t wrinkle
links_reviews_text: This is a beautiful dress with bright colors and soft fabric as it appears in the pictures. It fit true to size in my opinion, even though I’m 26 weeks pregnant. I ordered the XS and would order the same size again at my pre-pregnancy weight (5’4, 108lbs).
I ordered an XS P, my normal size, and it was gigantic. It's a pretty dress and the quality seemed good, but unfortunately, I won't be wearing it.

I loved the hot pink and pattern on this dress, but it was cut HUGE. I ordered in my normal size (L) and it was literally shocking how big it was. Worked as a swimsuit coverup but it fit way too loosely to look like a normal dress.
